name: ScanComponentsPCB
tagline: Test-bed SmoothieBoard Electronic Test. This application permit to test if missing components on the SmoothieBoard electronic card.
body:
###   Welcome to ScanComponentsPCB Pages.

## What is ScanComponentsPCB ?

ScanComponentsPCB is a software available on Linux 32-bit/64-bit or Windows  32-bit/64-bit (it is also available on MacOS and Android: see below) programmed with Processing in Java, which can detect possible missing components on a electronic card. The project consists of a software part and hardware part. 

software part contains a database in which there is all the coordinates of 307 components of the SmoothieBoard card in millimeter. The mechanical/hardware part includes SolidWorks plans for the construction of the test-bed, which can be made with wood and magnets for adjusting the webcam.

a exemple of test-bed prototype:

![test-bed prototype](http://s23.postimg.org/lrvnh21ej/Test_bed1.png)


![](http://s16.postimg.org/h2z48gbtx/Test_bed2.png)


![](http://s29.postimg.org/cg188npvb/test_bed3.png)


If you're wish using the ScanComponentsPCB for Mac, simply export the ScanComponentsPCB.pde file which Processing for Mac. If you're wish using the ScanComponentsPCB for Android, please refer to this Web page:
http://wiki.processing.org/w/Android.


### SmoothieBoard

SmoothieBoard is an Open Source Hardware CNC controller board based on the LPC 1769 or LPC1768 Cortex-M3 chip.
It is intended to run the Smoothie modular firmware ( GPL too ), and is targeted at 3D Printers, Laser cutters, CNC Mills, Pick and place and other small-sized CNC machines. Larger machines can be driven using the bare version and external drivers. Sources : http://smoothieware.org/smoothieboard.

### Detection of missing components

ScanComponentsPCB use the opencv for Processing library for detect missing components :

![Check your electronic card](http://s28.postimg.org/9uyx0dva5/Check_Your_Electric_Card.png)

![Find the list of missing components](http://s7.postimg.org/qje3ah623/list_Of_Missing_Component.png)

One click on a missing component in the drop down list permit to access open a web page, where you can buy the missing component.

### Authors and Contributors
In August 2014, Christopher Sainsaulieu (@ChristopherSainsaulieu) produced ScanComponentsPCB.

### Support or Contact
Having trouble with Pages? Check out the documentation at https://github.com/ChristopherSainsaulieu/ScanComponentsPCB or contact c1sainsa@enib.fr and weâ€™ll help you sort it out.
